alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Botetourt; Franklin; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Roanoke, northwestern Bedford, southern Botetourt and northern Franklin Counties, the City of Salem and the City of Roanoke through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Daleville to near Bent Mountain. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs, small weaker rooted trees and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Buchanan... Troutville... Boones Mill... and Stewartsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
